result.execSummary:
The defendant Arlow C. Hess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program. DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges. Sentence to commence forthwith.

Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid.   Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arlow C. Hess

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:17 a.m. Defendant Arlow C. Hess in court with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner.  Defendant Arlow C. Hess in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have received and reviewed the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. The parties stipulate to 60 days CFTS. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing recommendation by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Roberts-Turner. Statement by DE. Court orders: 9 mos WC Jail - Huber, GT, 60 days CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith, Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 8, 2017 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

15CF77 & 15CF121 Cases called @ 2:41 p.m. Defendant Arlow C. Hess in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 15CF121 - Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping contrary to Wis Stat 946.49(1)(a).  Plea: 15CF77 Ct 1 - Guilty. 15CF121 Ct 1 - Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CF77 Ct 2- DRI. 15CF121 Ct 2 - DRI. Repeater enhancer on 15CF121 Ct 1 dismissed. Statement by DE. Court orders: 15CF77 - S/W 30 mos probation - 4 days CFTS, Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, DNA sample and surcharge, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 

15CF121 - 120 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 44 days CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - concurrent with 15CF77 -Maintain status as a participant in good standing in the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program. All other conditions the same as 15CF77. Appeal rights given.

15CF-77 and 15CF-121 - Both Cases Called @ 3:40 PM: Defendant Arlow C. Hess in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Readings Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing today as to both matters. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing as to both matters.  Def BOT.  INFO filed as to each matter.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP received and entered as to both matters.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Case Called @ 1:12 PM: Defendant Arlow C. Hess in court, appearing Pro Se via video conferencing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes for the record the unpaid financial obligations still owed to COC which are approx $4600 with no payments in the last 14 mos.  Court addresses nonappearance in June.  Def states he was in GL Co jail at the time and was transferred here from Green Lake release.  Def asks for Court Appt - states he is not eligible for SPD services.  Def does not know the reason for SPD declining eligibility.  Def states he is employed.   ADA believes ES sanction sentence was served in GL Co Jail.  As to fine/costs owed - Def states he would only be able to make a small payment and willing to submit to new payment plan.  ADA not opposed to bond continuing.  The Court:  Will continue $2500 Signature Bond.  As to unpaid financial obligations:  The Court finds contempt basis exists - Def has the capacity to make the payments.  Imposes 6 mos WCJ - Purge:  Make an initial payment of $250. Commencing on 9/1/2015 and continuing on the first of each month thereafter, maintain $100 monthly payment until PIF.    Def requests to speak to the State on his own prior to deciding on counsel issue.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Case called @ 2:40 a.m. Defendant Arlow C. Hess not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non appearance the court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the Continental US. 08CM222, 08CM78 & 08TR270 - Fail to pay warrants to be re-issued.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called 1:10 PM: Defendant Arlow C. Hess in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    Per SPD:  Eligibility will depend on custody status.  Confirms a current PO Hold in place.  ADA argues as to bond - Def on ES from a Green Lake Co Charge and states there are several FTP Warrants here in Waushara Co as well.  SPD argues as to bond request - No position as to bond conditions requested.  Address on complaint is the current address for Def.  The Court:  $2500 Signature Bond ordered with conditions as requested.   Outstanding warrants to track along with this proceeding.   IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
